source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Luzula
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Luzula. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves densely hairy along margin (hairs mostly appearing as an unbroken marginal line); plants usually bulbous at base; tepals and capsules pale to dark brown; inflorescence rarely reduced to a single cluster
Leaves rather sparsely hairy along margin; plants rarely bulbous at base; tepals and capsules yellowish to mid-brown; inflorescence not infrequently reduced to a single cluster
Tepals c. 3 mm long; anthers c. 1 mm long; capsule subequal to tepals
Tepals 2–2.5 mm long; anthers 0.4–0.5 mm long; capsule often shortly exceeding tepals
